title: Man arrested in SWAT standoff believed to be linked to child’s murder
content:
Please install the latest Adobe Flash Player Plugin to watch this content.
DAYTON, Ohio (WDTN) – Following a three-hour standoff in the early morning hours Monday, Dayton police now tell 2 NEWS that 25-year-old Shawn Smith is believed to be linked to the shooting death of 13-month-old Elijah Johnson last week.
Dayton Police confirmed the suspected connection between Smith and the shooting that occurred Thursday night on Queens Avenue.
According to jail records, Shawn Smith, 25, is being charged with murder. Police say a woman was also in the home during the standoff. Jade Taylor, 22, is being charged on interfering with law enforcement.
Police originally were dispatched to the home to make an arrest on Smith–a homicide suspect; however, Smith and Taylor would not leave the house when asked.
SWAT and hostage negotiators were in a standoff with the suspects for more than three hours.
Dayton Police tell 2 NEWS an armored vehicle had to bust through a front door of the home, in order for Smith and Taylor to turn themselves in.
No shots were fired, and police were able to make the arrests without incident.
Smith is due in court on Tuesday at 1:45 p.m.
